Award.AwardTitle: Complex Analysis, Potential Theory, Special Functions and Applications, November 6-9, 2014
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding to help cover the travel expenses of participants to the "2014 Red Raider Mini-Symposium" to be held November 6-9, 2014, at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas.

The symposium will feature five plenary talks on the topics of gravitational lensing, circle packing, hyperbolic metrics, and other topics in Geometric Function Theory and Mathematical Physics. There will be special talks of general interest from Professor M. Dorff on "Movies and Mathematics" and Professor C. Beneteau on "Women in Mathematics". Further, there will be a special reception during which undergraduate and graduate students may meet and discuss mathematics with the plenary speakers. Opportunities will be made available for eary career mathematicians to present and discuss their work to participants at this conference.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project supported travel to the 2014 Red Raider Mini-Symposium on Complex Analysis, Potential Theory, Special Functions, and Applications. 

The symposium featured 5 plenary talks and 17 contributed talks by internationally recognized researchers including

Nadya Askaripour, University of Cincinnati

Catherine Beneteau, South Florida University

Atul Dixit, Tulane University

Michael Dorff, Brigham Young University

Richard Fournier, University of Montreal

Parisa Hariri, University of Turku, Finland

David Herron, University of Cincinnati

Aimo Hinkanen, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

Dmitry Khavinson, South Florida University

Richard Laugesen, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

Erik Lundberg, Florida Atlantic University

YJ Leung, University of Delaware

Anton Lukyanenko, University of Michigan

David Minda, Taft Professor, University of Cincinnati

Eric Murphy, United States Air Force

Stephan Ruscheweyh, University of Würzburg, Germany

Nages Shanmugalingam, University of Cincinnati

Ken Stephenson, University of Tennessee

Bartlomiej Siudeja, University of Oregon

Matti Vuorinen, University of Helsinki, Finland

Shanshuang Yang, Emory University

Alexander Vasiliev, University of Bergen, Norway

In addition, Michael Dorff presented a special talk for undergraduates on Movies and Mathematics and Catherine Beneteau presented a speical talk on Women in Mathematics.

Researchers attended from 10 different states and 5 foreign countries including Canada, China, Finland, Germany, and Norway.

This project supported the travel of 12 researchers who attended the symposium.


Last Modified: 01/26/2016
Modified by: George B Williams
